dtliExcerpt: To the great credit of everyone involved, “The Notebook” also delivers unexpectedly sophisticated theatricality with the requisite supercharging of the tear ducts, notwithstanding an archly familiar narrative.
showScoreExcerpt: "The Notebook is leaping off the page and onto the stage...its finest adaptation yet."
bwwExcerpt: There are two main reasons why this show works. Most important is the songwriter Ingrid Michaelson, who might be a Broadway newcomer, but whose lyrics eschew the mawkish pitfalls in favor of simple, direct communication of intense but familiar emotions through melody and song.
